revised_title: The Management and Use of the Common Seal in Deeds
tldr: This article outlines the rules and procedures for using the Common Seal of the Royal Society in deeds and documents. It specifies that the seal should be kept in a secure iron chest and that all documents must be approved and signed by the President and other Council members before the seal can be affixed.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Legal History
